post.body: You asked a question that people were probably curious about. Thanks.
I get enquiries about my services via the blog daily. That's why there's no ads on the blog - dont need them. Great question.
Thank you sir!
Thats bad - stress without chocolate... shouldn't be allowed to happen.
Hi Kati - Glad you liked it. Good to 'see' you again on Twitter.
No long weekend here in the UK - The week's started off really well though.... more of the same tomorrow.
;) Busy day today - playing catch-up after last week.
Yep...Friends = Good....Unexpected internal waterfal = Bad.
At least you have all week to turn it around! :)
Welcome - I'm seeing Sphinn more and more these days.
That's not stress - it's excitement in disguise :)
Cooooooooool!
Not bad - busy but productive! Say helloo to Tuesday for me!! :)
That's one of the great things about twitter!
You are welcome - good that your weeks starting so well!
I'm following you now, so you can dm me & keep 'the noise' down.
Thanks for that! Is it stable?
I actually made the bottom - :-)
@oo00_Mr_K_00oo Don't add the http://www. Just use the name.com
Possible. It was my first thought.
yes
lol
Seems fine from here.
I knew that was coming :)
Thanki Rob!
Thanks - glad you like it!
People usually ask if I can RT a link to a website or a request for people to follow them.
Thanks Jesse - That means a lot to me :)
The version of tweet deck I am using is not ready for release yet (according to the tweet deck people.) Seems ok so far.
All my contact details are on my blog - click the contact tab at the top of the screen.
I asked people a few weeks ago if I should just say hello - but they liked the way my greeting shows my time zone.
what's your blog's URL Sue?
I don't use FaceBook - Only so many hours in the day :)
I follow a few like that - Leo Laporte for example.
Really? That was nice of you - thanks Eva :)
Just did - It makes no sense.
No idea.
says you can tell an 'a lister' by their twitter grader score. REALLY?
It's a forest - what did you expect to find there?
Not for my blog, but fairly close on one of my websites.
Thanks Joanne - you have GREAT taste! :-)
Just going through the stats on my blog - nothing too exciting :)
Not if they follow 500 people then unfollow them 2 hours later!
Just been reading feedback from http://tinyurl.com/56oh4v
No rest for the wicked eh Jay? ;-)
sounds like a good plan to me.
It's really useful.
I'm great - just enjoying a nice, lazy weekend.
Yes I am.
Busy! People realize they need great marketing in this economy, if they want to thrive or survive, thankfully, I get the call.
Thanks man!
Morning sir - how's you?
Hey Irene!!
It's 5:30pm here in England - So, that's good evening (I think) :)
I remember that!
nope ;-(
Absolutely!
You 'may' have just overshared???????? :)
LOL - :)
about half a dozen!
You get a special pass for Abba if you're Swedish!
Take a look http://tinyurl.com/57eal4
Yeah - I have to say I also LOVE Disco Inferno from the Saturday Night Fever album. 'I feel so dirty'
That's 'pretty' cool.
Would it make it easier if I reTweeted that to 10,000 people :)
It's when I started marketing my blog - blog and my twitter account are closely linked.
Thanks Chuck!
Why not give Tweet Deck a try?
Thanks - that means a lot to me.
top right of each post, click where it says how many comments there are & it shows all comments & where to leave yours :)
I saw that too - weird, he's following my buddy @scobleizer and he has 4x the followers I have :)
Only problem, is if you put the '@' part of the username in, it fails. Only one person done it so far. Testing 4 tomorrow.
Keep in touch and let me know if you need anything again!!
You gained me as a follower too! Keep in touch :)
Done - Hope it helps!!
He just explained that I had too many followers now, so I wasn't worth following.
Sorry to see you go Tim - All the best!
Not sure mate.
Chris Brogan's a businessman, making money with his blog. The market will decide what it thinks & Chris will be fine. Watch!
I think that ads & sponsorships will GROW as the recession kicks in & people look to monetize their blogs. Not for me though.
Thanks
Evening - It's 9:25pm here.
It's a matter of getting the right business model for a commercial blog & then working the model correctly.
Totally! :-)
Good luck with the new sponsorship Chris - It's certainly getting a lot of attention.
Thanks for the RT - Much appreciated Jesse.
I literally just answered this here - Kevin. http://tinyurl.com/6g8fld
Read this http://tinyurl.com/6g8fld
You were one of a few who made same comment - it worked though. :-)
Of course - always. It only works that way around.
It simply helps avoid the backlog of messages - :-)
I think another reason I get so many comments is that people feel comfortable with me. None of that guru bullshit - I detest it.
It's here http://tinyurl.com/6mv7wh
Absolutely, but for other bogs advertising is a great idea.
You are welcome - keep in touch.
Good for you Tom - Let me know how it works out for you!
Most people do - one out of over 11,000's pretty good :-)
Nope - I was re-tweeting what was coming in. I don't regard that as spam myself - just unnecessary.
How?
At any 1 time Im getting tweets from a fairly small group, interested in whatever 'that' subject is. I use tweet deck.
I'm following you.
What possible reason would you have for doing that - before you even know what they like?
I agree. I dedicate 100% of my 'twitter time' to twitter - with tweet deck & touch typing it's not too hard to converse.
You only need to communicate with those who, at any one time, engage you. Otherwise, 100 followers would be impossible.
Thank You!!!!!!!!
It's hard to have a one way conversation and claim to be 'into' social media!
I live on a farm, so the air's always 'fresh.'
Time for me to get some sleep. Big day tomorrow. If you need anything, you can get me here: http://tinyurl.com/6553lb Good night ;-)
This was REALLY popular, got over 100 emails and almost 80 comments already: http://tinyurl.com/6ls5nk
How's Monday been for *YOU* thus far?
Another well-written post by @sciencebase "6 Degrees of Separation" http://tinyurl.com/2wndu7
From @tomchapman http://tinyurl.com/6y3bc6
I'm out of here - Good night from a cold and icy Yorkshire, England.
BTW: If you follow @TweetDeck you will be kept up-to-date with the best Twitter App on the market (In my humble opinion!)
Time for me to go! It's been great, thanks for all the ideas! ;-)
RT @FranMagbual: version with spell check is v0.20.1b
OPEN QUESTION: I've had 3 people tell me Tweet Deck has a spell check facility. Where? I'm using latest version. Thanks :)
Everyone spells my name wrong http://tinyurl.com/6rpqul
Had this sent to me by several people: http://downforeveryoneorjustme.com/ if it works its a GREAT idea!
MASSIVE thanks to everyone who's checked to see if the blog's working. Had around 4 who can't access it and around 80 who can. Weird.
Had 2 who couldnt see my blog and around 10 who could. weird.
Message from @styletime says he can't see http://jimsmarketingblog.com Anyone else have a problem displaying it?
RT @jcornelius: the value of Twitter isn't the service, it's the community.
Oh man......OK - I wrote the word WRTIE instead of RIGHT.... When tweet deck add a spell checker following 9000 people will be a lot easier!
I'm off to bed. Have a great day / night and do this again soon! Good Night!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
BTW: The http://jimsmarketingblog.com/ reader poll is in the left sidebar - Thanks!
REQUEST: Can you please vote on the reader poll: http://jimsmarketingblog.com Im using the stats for an upcoming post, thanks! :)
The idea is that people can see your comment, realize how great you are and then follow you on Twitter.
We are looking to add a new tool to my blog, where you can post your twitter @username to your comments. Your thoughts please?
Most common request I get is "Can you ask your followers to follow me?" Next is"Can you ask your followers to go to this link?"
That's the first time ever I asked a question and got the 100% same response. It seems it's ok not to retweet everything I get asked.
I'm hearing that LinkedIn and Yahoo Answers are useful for questions (plus Google).
RT @chuckhester: believe that camcorder question could get answered on LinkedIn Answers section - just a thought!
I get about 15/20 RT requests each time I start a conversation on Twitter. Hard to draw the line, but I do try to keep on topic.
RT @lincolnluxor: I think they just went to the wrong type of expert... maybe @chrispirillo would have been a better choice
I understand the idea, the person wanted me to ask a wide group of people for help. I assumed it was too off topic?
I just got a DM, asking me to tweet about a camcorder problem someone has. I didn't & she accused me of being unhelpful - Thoughts?
RT @PeteHall: Or use this for clarifying a direct convo: http://is.gd/4y42
Catch you all later - I'm off out for some lunch now!
"How to quickly boost your marketing results" http://tinyurl.com/63d88h
If you are into furniture or interior design, Leslie @tkpleslie is well worth following! She's also a lot of fun!!
Just published a new post n my blog, all about how to improve your marketing by focusing your sales message.
Good morning! :)
Gotta fly - Catch you all later. If you need anything, I'm here: http://jimsmarketingblog.com/contact/
RT @TwitterWhore: Heyyyyyy, is being known as a twitter whore a GOOD thing or a BAD thing??? Hmmmmm. . . http://is.gd/afeC
RT @FrostingJewelry: If someone considers themselves and "A-Lister" and shares this with others, they are actually an "A-Hole" (I agree)
RT @ShatteredScreen: I "feel" like an A Lister...but I also "feel" if I run fast enough I'll be able to fly.
RT @fabiolaf: Twitter "A listers" are Twitter whores, lol.
RT @velvet_trope: On DMs: if they don't follow you back, you can't DM, A-listers don't follow back unless you're coequals (maybe) 1/2
Time for me to catch-up on some podcasts and then off to bed - what a glamorous life I lead :) Good night!
BTW: My FriendFeed user name is the same as it is here 'jimconnolly' you are welcome to join me there - useful when Twitter goes offline.
RT @mousewords: The spirit of Robin Hood must have been with you. He focused on one segment of the market, after all. ;-)
BTW: I wrote that post sat on a felled tree, in Sherwood Forest. No sign of Robin Hood.
Apparently, this was the most read page on the blog this week: http://tinyurl.com/63d88h such a short post too?
I don't know why they do it either.
Is it just me, or are YOU noticing lots more people using the 'follow then un-follow' method for building their twitter follower numbers?
So, what are *you* doing right now?
I LOVE what @JaimieH is doing here - well worth following her!
Hello!
Time for me to catch up on a few podcasts and grab some sleep. Thanks to everyone who's been kind enough to connect tonight, great fun!
Looks like http://tinyurl.com/6ls5nk will be most read this week.
RT @backdraft916: confession: we have "Rescue Me" by Fontella Bass 'cued up in the fire engine's tape deck.
RT @doctorious: "You can't tweet this..."
I have this vision of someone following me, hoping for gems of marketing advice & grabbing stacks of naff music selections instead :)
RT @FrostingJewelry: I know all of the words to "Ice Ice Baby" by Vanilla Ice by heart. Did I just tweet that outloud? (No, I did!)
As he is a fellow Tweeter, is it ok to admit I have @mchammer s 'turn this mutha out' on my iPod & love it?
Lots of Abba mentions now.... Seems to be mainly Abba, 70's disco, Barbie Girl by Aqua and 9-to-5 by Dolly Parton.
Here's your answers http://tinyurl.com/57eal4 must be over 100 by now?
RT @webguyatwork: Team building and commenting on other people's sites is an excellent way to build your followers. Thanks for the link!
Thanks to @thetechnewsblog for this http://twitterholic.com/jimconnolly/ Is that accurate?
Thanks to @kylereddoch for the link - much appreciated Kyle!!
"Building your twitter network: http://tinyurl.com/5uv8lg Let me know what you think!
Hello!
Comment at http://tinyurl.com/6elpol & U can include twitter username, to link straight to your twitter profile, so new peeps can follow you
RT @humanrightsday: Can you please spread the word about @HumanRightsDay and their petition? Would mean a LOT http://bit.ly/zk0a Thank you
So, I posted http://tinyurl.com/6g8fld and now off for a read then bed - Good night! :-)
As I say in the post, I am VERY pro advertising & sponsorships - but for my own blog it's a totally different business model.
"No advertising or sponsors!" http://tinyurl.com/6g8fld Just posted this after our tweets earlier.
Back in 30 minutes! :-)
Goodnight everyone - Have a GREAT weekend!!!!
http://tinyurl.com/4a8azd This afternoon's post got 64 comments so far - amazing.
Just had 1st ever complaint about answering too many questions & filling a person's screen. I answer 99% via DM.
RT @damienbasile: I've realized that the best way for me to manage Twitter is through the web with multiple tabs. No API limits etc
RT @RobynsWorld: I never click on the free report, free ebook, type links in twitter - they just sound like spam even
RT @anhonestwriter: you can do it all manually when you have the mindset of nurturing relationships rather than managing leads.
RT @AnthonyRusso: TwitterSpam is an oxymoron as its completely opt-in. If you don't want to see it can opt out(unfollow) But hate auto DM
RT @david_n_wilson: Not only that, but it assumes you were too dense to see his website in his profile when you followed.
RT @mihaisecasiu: i Automated dm with a link right after I follow someone. Most of that I see as spam.
BTW: If you use those horrible (thanks for following check out my blog) services - seems people treat it as spam!
Don't forget to vote in the "Reader Poll" http://jimsmarketingblog.com
Catch up with you later :-)
...listening to 'Satin Chic' by Goldfrapp
Good intro to RSS: http://tinyurl.com/5fhhfp
RT @jugalmakwana: I prefer RSS feeds....have subscribed to many of those, Would visit the blog only if i find the feed interesting enough .
RT @WebOptimization: I don't use RSS. I like to visit the blogs I read
RT @jayxtreme: anyone not using RSS is missing a big piece of the pie ;)
How many of you DON'T use RSS?
RT @doctorious: The more I'm on Twitter the more blogs I read and the more I'm inspired to blog - which I then tweet about. It's a circle.
I must read 30 blog posts a day - twice that at weekends. What about you?
I highly recommend you follow my buddy Calvin @mayhemstudios - A helpful and genuinely nice guy!
I also think bloggers tend to read more blogs than non-bloggers. I read LOADS!
90% of people who voted on my blog, say they are bloggers too! Amazingly high percentage.
Look at the reader poll here: http://jimsmarketingblog.com/ so many bloggers read my blog!
Gooooooooood morning!
New poll on my blog - Please vote! http://jimsmarketingblog.com (The Reader Poll is just above the Twitter button!)
If you want to follow someone who will always give you very direct feedback, I recommend my twitter buddy Tim Jahn @timjahn
